nodes.name: diagnosis
nodes.description: Data from the investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

properties.name: age_at_diagnosis
properties.description: Age at the time of diagnosis expressed in number of days since birth. If the age is greater than 32872 days (89 years), see 'age_at_diagnosis_gt89'.

properties.name: age_at_diagnosis_gt89
properties.description: Indicate whether the 'Age at the time of diagnosis expressed in number of days since birth' is greater than 32872 days (89 years).

properties.name: ajcc_clinical_m
properties.description: Extent of the distant metastasis for the cancer based on evidence obtained from the clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

properties.name: ajcc_clinical_n
properties.description: Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

properties.name: ajcc_clinical_stage
properties.description: Stage group determined from clinical information on the tumor (T), regional node (N) and metastases (M) and by grouping cases with similar prognosis for cancer.

properties.name: ajcc_clinical_t
properties.description: Extent of the primary cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

properties.name: ajcc_pathologic_m
properties.description: Code to represent the defined absence or presence of distant spread or metastases (M) to locations via vascular channels or lymphatics beyond the regional lymph nodes, using criteria established by the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC).

properties.name: ajcc_pathologic_n
properties.description: The codes that represent the stage of cancer based on the nodes present (N stage) according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC’s Cancer Staging Manual.

properties.name: ajcc_pathologic_stage
properties.description: The extent of a cancer, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body based on AJCC staging criteria.

properties.name: ajcc_pathologic_t
properties.description: Code of pathological T (primary tumor) to define the size or contiguous extension of the primary tumor (T), using staging criteria from the American Joint Committee on Cancer.

properties.name: ann_arbor_b_symptoms
properties.description: Text term to signify whether lymphoma B-symptoms are present as noted in the patient’s medical record.

properties.name: ann_arbor_clinical_stage
properties.description: The classification of the clinically confirmed anatomic disease extent of lymphoma (Hodgkin’s and Non-Hodgkin’s) based on the Ann Arbor Staging System.

properties.name: ann_arbor_extranodal_involvement
properties.description: Indicator that identifies whether a patient with malignant lymphoma has lymphomatous involvement of an extranodal site.

properties.name: ann_arbor_pathologic_stage
properties.description: The classification of the pathologically confirmed anatomic disease extent of lymphoma (Hodgkin’s and Non-Hodgkin’s) based on the Ann Arbor Staging System.

properties.name: best_overall_response
properties.description: The best improvement achieved throughout the entire course of protocol treatment.

properties.name: burkitt_lymphoma_clinical_variant
properties.description: Burkitt’s lymphoma categorization based on clinical features that differ from other forms of the same disease.

properties.name: cause_of_death
properties.description: Text term to identify the cause of death for a patient.

properties.name: circumferential_resection_margin
properties.description: A value in millimeters indicating the measured length between a malignant lesion of the colon or rectum and the nearest radial (or circumferential) border of tissue removed during cancer surgery.

properties.name: classification_of_tumor
properties.description: Text that describes the kind of disease present in the tumor specimen as related to a specific timepoint.

properties.name: colon_polyps_history
properties.description: Yes/No indicator to describe if the subject had a previous history of colon polyps as noted in the history/physical or previous endoscopic report(s).

properties.name: days_to_best_overall_response
properties.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date of the patient’s best overall response.

properties.name: days_to_birth
properties.description: Time interval from a person’s date of birth to the date of initial pathologic diagnosis, represented as a calculated negative number of days.

properties.name: days_to_death
properties.description: Time interval from a person’s date of death to the date of initial pathologic diagnosis, represented as a calculated number of days.

properties.name: days_to_diagnosis
properties.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date of diagnosis.

properties.name: days_to_hiv_diagnosis
properties.description: Time interval from the date of the initial pathologic diagnosis to the date of human immunodeficiency diagnosis, represented as a calculated number of days.

properties.name: days_to_last_follow_up
properties.description: Time interval from the date of late follow up to the date of initial pathologic diagnosis, represented as a calculated number of days.

properties.name: days_to_last_known_disease_status
properties.description: Time interval from the date of last follow up to the date of initial pathologic diagnosis, represented as a calculated number of days.

properties.name: days_to_new_event
properties.description: Time interval from the date of new tumor event including progression, recurrence and new primary malignancies to the date of initial pathologic diagnosis, represented as a calculated number number of days.

properties.name: days_to_recurrence
properties.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the patient was diagnosed with a recurrent malignancy.

properties.name: figo_stage
properties.description: The extent of a cervical or endometrial cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body, as described by the International Federation of Gynecology and Obstetrics (FIGO) stages.

properties.name: hist_subtype1
properties.description: Subtype of the microscopic structure of tissues

properties.name: histology
properties.description: Result of the microscopic structure of tissues

properties.name: hiv_positive
properties.description: Text term to signify whether a physician has diagnosed HIV infection in a patient.

properties.name: hpv_positive_type
properties.description: Text classification to represent the strain or type of human papillomavirus identified in an individual.

properties.name: hpv_status
properties.description: The findings of the oncogenic HPV.

properties.name: iss_stage
properties.description: The multiple myeloma disease stage at diagnosis.

properties.name: last_known_disease_status
properties.description: Text term that describes the last known state or condition of an individual’s neoplasm.

properties.name: laterality
properties.description: For tumors in paired organs, designates the side on which the cancer originates.

properties.name: ldh_level_at_diagnosis
properties.description: The 2 decimal place numeric laboratory value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of lactate dehydrogenase in a specimen.

properties.name: ldh_normal_range_upper
properties.description: The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for lactate dehydrogenase (units not specified).

properties.name: lymph_nodes_positive
properties.description: The number of lymph nodes involved with disease as determined by pathologic examination.

properties.name: lymphatic_invasion_present
properties.description: A yes/no indicator to ask if small or thin-walled vessel invasion is present, indicating lymphatic involvement.

properties.name: method_of_diagnosis
properties.description: The method used to initially determine the patient’s diagnosis.

properties.name: morphology
properties.description: The third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000 used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) or neoplasms. The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs. In pathology, the microscopic process or identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains. A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

properties.name: new_event_anatomic_site
properties.description: Text term to specify the anatomic location of the return of tumor after treatment.

properties.name: new_event_type
properties.description: Text term to identify a new tumor event.

properties.name: overall_survival
properties.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the patient’s date of death or the date the patient was last known to be alive.

properties.name: perineural_invasion_present
properties.description: A yes/no indicator to ask if perineural invasion or inflitration of tumor or cancer is present.

properties.name: primary_diagnosis
properties.description: Text term for the structural pattern of cancer cells used to define a microscopic diagnosis.

properties.name: prior_malignancy
properties.description: Text term to describe the patient’s history of prior cancer diagnosis and the spatial location of any previous cancer occurrence.

properties.name: prior_treatment
properties.description: A yes/no/unknown/not applicable indicator related to the administration of therapeutic agents received before the body specimen was collected.

properties.name: progression_free_survival
properties.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the first date the patient is known to be free of disease progression.

properties.name: progression_free_survival_event
properties.description: The event used to define the patient’s disease progression.

properties.name: progression_or_recurrence
properties.description: Yes/No/Unknown indicator to identify whether a patient has had a new tumor event after initial treatment.

properties.name: residual_disease
properties.description: Text terms to describe the status of a tissue margin following surgical resection.

properties.name: site_of_resection_or_biopsy
properties.description: The third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000, used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms. The description of an anatomical region or of a body part. Named locations of, or within, the body. A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

properties.name: tissue_or_organ_of_origin
properties.description: Text term that describes the anatomic site of the tumor or disease.

properties.name: tumor_grade
properties.description: Numeric value to express the degree of abnormality of cancer cells, a measure of differentiation and aggressiveness.

properties.name: tumor_stage
properties.description: The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body. The accepted values for tumor_stage depend of the tumor site, type, and accepted staging system. These items should accompany the tumor_stage value as associated metadata.

properties.name: vascular_invasion_present
properties.description: The yes/no indicator to ask if large vessel or venous invasion was detected by surgery or presence in a tumor specimen.

properties.name: vital_status
properties.description: The survival state of the person registered on the protocol.

properties.name: year_of_diagnosis
properties.description: Numeric value to represent the year of an individual’s initial pathologic diagnosis of cancer.

nodes.name: follow_up

A visit has a start and an end, each described with a rule. The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained before and after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.

Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
